description.narrative:
KAISAHAN proposes an initiative to increase the involvement of the youth in the farm activities of their family through an innovation that we will call the #Family Farm Plot Development and Field-Based Mentorship Program.# This initiative will not only tap on theinclination of the youth to agriculture through out-of-the-box agricultural capacity-building, but also their relationship with their ARB parents through the mentorship feature. This innovation will also tap on the preservation and transfer of traditional farm practices through new-age technologies, and support service access for both senior and next generation of farmers.
At the end of this12-month project, KAISAHAN hopes to achieve the following:
(1) Elderly farmers with additional farmhelp. This will be achieved by increasing the involvement of family members especially the youth in farm activities. This is expected to happen by transferring customary and acquired farming technologies through field school and series of sharing sessionswith young family members.Young members of ARB households with increased participation in diversified family farming. This will be achieved through orientation on the agrarian reform program, series of training, and field-based family farm development andmentorship.
(2) Young members of ARB householdswith increased participation in family farming. This will be achieved through orientation on the importance of sustaining the cultivation of land awarded to elderly members of their families under theagrarian reform program, and through series of sharing and training, and field-based family farm development and mentorship. Diversified farming processes and techniques are preserved and transferred to next generation of farmers. This will involve educational communication materials development to document, preserve, and disseminate the best practices done in cultivating the family farms.
(3) Diversified farming processes and techniques are preserved and transferred to next generation of farmers. Thiswill involve educational communication materials development to document, preserve, and disseminate the best practices done in cultivating the family farms. Agrarian reform beneficiaries with access to support services. This . is focused on capacitating the youth on project proposal development and market linking to help their families and other agrarian reform beneficiaries/farmer organizations.
This innovation hopes to increase the interest of young women and men farmers through actual and documentation of farming practices handed down by their elders.

participating-org.narrative: KAISAHAN is a non-government organization promoting a sustainable and humane society. Its aim is to empower marginalized groups in rural areas, especially of farmers and farmworkers, to undertake their own development, participate fully in democratic processes and demand their rightful share in the stewardship of the land and the fruits of their labor. To achieve its goals, KAISAHAN trains farmer paralegal who are adept at agrarian reform laws and regulations and are able to assert their rights and assist other farmers inclaiming their land rights. KAISAHAN also engages with appropriate government institutions in creating and ensuring a positive policy environment for farmers and the marginalized sectors. It also provides legal services to farmers involving their land rights, organize and link farmers with agencies and institutions that will provide sustainable use and maximization of land and its resources. In its 28 years of existence, it has supported farmers in claiming their rights under the Comprehensive Agrarian Reform Program (CARP). Notably, in 2015 KAISAHAN assisted agrarian reform beneficiaries (ARBs) in Ormoc, Leyte who have been awarded titles under the CARP but could not take possession of the same because of the land owner#s resistance.Through KAISAHAN#s intervention and engagement with the Department of Agrarian Reform (DAR) and the security sector, particularly the Philippine National Police (PNP), the ARBs where officially installed in their awarded lands. Since then, they have beencultivating the area and reaping the benefits of their hard-fought land. KAISAHAN has also trained farmer paralegals who became active leaders in their respective communities. As an organization engaged in policy advocacy, KAISAHAN was one of the primemovers in the passage of Republic Act 9700 or the Comprehensive Agrarian Reform Program with Extension and Reforms (CARPER). It provided legal and technical assistance to legislators in the crafting of the law. At present it serves as the secretariat of theCampaign for Land Use Policy Now, a network of civil society organizations (CSOs) and people#s organizations (POs) pushing for the passage of the National Land Use Act (NLUA).
KAISAHAN tungo sa Kaunlaran ng Kana at Repormang Pansakahan
